conclusion: Physics analysis of objects moving through air
Setup with objects labeled A through F; A and B are fabric pieces/cloths, C, D, E, and F are solid blocks
Object A is a checkered/gingham patterned cloth
Object B is a zigzag/chevron patterned cloth
Object C is a green cube
Object D is a red/brown cube
Object E is a blue cube
Object F is a dark gray/black rectangular block
Cloths A and B are laid flat on a circular table with blocks C, D, E, and F on top
Objects A and B move through the air and interact with blocks C, D, E, and F due to gravity
Cloths deform and drape over or around the blocks
Cloths create folds and contours following the shapes of the blocks
Gravity pulls the cloths downward, conforming to blocks and surface below
Object A will drape over and around blocks at positions C and D
Object B will drape over and around blocks at positions E and F
Cloths deform according to fabric properties under gravity
Height and shape of each block determine cloth rise and folds
Cloths drape over blocks due to gravity, creating folds conforming to block shapes
Blocks act as support structures creating elevated points in the cloth
Gravity pulls cloth downward around support points, creating fabric folds and contours
Third image shows cloths draped over blocks creating undulating surfaces
